1.content: Test claim intake wizard accessibility and navigation
1.details: 1. Access the claim intake wizard from the application. 2. Test wizard step navigation (forward/backward). 3. Verify all wizard steps are reachable and display correctly. 4. Document any navigation issues found.

2.content: Audit all form fields for display and functionality
2.details: 1. Go through each step of the wizard systematically. 2. Test every input field, dropdown, checkbox, radio button, and date picker. 3. Verify fields display correctly and accept input. 4. Check field validation and error handling. 5. Document all non-functional fields.

3.content: Test data persistence and saving functionality
3.details: 1. Fill out wizard forms with test data. 2. Navigate between steps to verify data persistence. 3. Complete the wizard and submit the claim. 4. Verify data is properly saved to the database. 5. Check that all field data appears in the saved claim record.

4.content: Fix identified field and functionality issues
4.details: 1. Analyze root causes of identified issues. 2. Fix form field display problems. 3. Repair data binding and validation issues. 4. Correct database saving functionality. 5. Ensure proper error handling for failed operations.

5.details: 1. Build and deploy the corrected application. 2. Re-test the complete wizard workflow. 3. Verify all previously broken fields now work correctly. 4. Confirm data saves properly to database. 5. Document final status of all fields.
